      Marker placePoint()  
      PlacePointTool.MarkerCreator setAction​(java.lang.String action)
      The ability to perform an action on the newly created marker after it is dropped.

      When set, the PlacePointTool will allow for dropping of duplicative names on the screen
      PlacePointTool.MarkerCreator setArchive​(boolean archive)
      Defaults to true and signals if this marker should be saved to the database This is different from nevercot since it allows for a marker to be turned into cursor on target but does not allow it to be persisted.

        value - the value to be added to the marker prior to persisting

      • setReadiness

        public PlacePointTool.MarkerCreator setReadiness​(boolean readiness)
        Sets the readiness flag for the marker. In ATAK, this does not visually change the icon but allows for a plugin to do so.
        Parameters:
        readiness - true or false
        Returns:
        the MarkerCreator for reuse in a chained call

        Returns:
        the MarkerCreator for reuse in a chained call

      • setShowFiveLine

        public PlacePointTool.MarkerCreator setShowFiveLine​(boolean show)
        For markers that when placed automatically show the five line when placed, show the five line based on the boolean
        Parameters:
        show - if true the five line will be shown.
        Returns:
        the MarkerCreator for reuse in a chained call

      • setIconPath

        public PlacePointTool.MarkerCreator setIconPath​(java.lang.String iconsetPath)
        The iconset path to use when rendering the icon for the marker
        Parameters:
        iconsetPath - the iconset path in the appropriate iconset format - usually asset://[uid]/directory/name
        Returns:
        the MarkerCreator for reuse in a chained call

      • disableAutomaticIcon

        public PlacePointTool.MarkerCreator disableAutomaticIcon​(boolean disable)
        If the flag is set to true, ATAK will make no effort to set an icon or change an icon for the marker dropped. The user is completely responsible for controlling the icon. This feature is dangerous and requires the plugin to fully manage the icon lifecycle.
        Returns:
        the MarkerCreator for reuse in a chained call

      • setNeverPersist

        public PlacePointTool.MarkerCreator setNeverPersist​(boolean persist)
        Defaults to false and indicates if this marker should never be turned into CoT
        Parameters:
        persist - true means it should never turn into CoT. This is different from archive which indicates that a marker can be turned into CoT.
        Returns:
        the MarkerCreator for chaining of calls

      • setArchive

        public PlacePointTool.MarkerCreator setArchive​(boolean archive)
        Defaults to true and signals if this marker should be saved to the database This is different from nevercot since it allows for a marker to be turned into cursor on target but does not allow it to be persisted.
        Parameters:
        archive - true for saving
        Returns:
        the MarkerCreator for reuse in a chained call

      • setAllowDuplicativeNames

        public PlacePointTool.MarkerCreator setAllowDuplicativeNames​(boolean duplicativeNames)
        When set, the PlacePointTool will allow for dropping of duplicative names on the screen
        Parameters:
        duplicativeNames - true if duplicative names will be allowed
        Returns:
        the MarkerCreator for reuse in a chained call

        public PlacePointTool.MarkerCreator setColor​(int color)
        Indicates the color of the marker.
        Parameters:
        color - used to multiply against the existing colors of the icon
        Returns:
        the MarkerCreator for reuse in a chained call

      • showCotDetails

        public PlacePointTool.MarkerCreator showCotDetails​(boolean showEditor)
        The ability to disable the editor from displaying when a marker is dropped.
        Parameters:
        showEditor - if showEditor is false, the editor is not shown when the marker is dropped.
        Returns:
        the MarkerCreator for reuse in a chained call
